Issues.Title: Fix 1353 Accessibility: Removing 'button' text from PrintButton accessible name of PrintPreviewDialog
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #1353 


## Proposed changes

- Removing "button" text from PrintButton control's Accessible name to have "Print" accessible name instead of "Print button".
- Updating resource string for PrintButton AccessibleName.
- Reassigning to translators for updating localized strings.

## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

Please see the bug #1353 

### After

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23213980/61126850-47603000-a4b6-11e9-8308-68e395e4a2e9.png)

## Test methodology

- Manual testing
- Narrator announcement
- Inspect tool

## Accessibility testing

Narrator announces "Print button" with the fix and "Print button, button" without the fix.
Inspect shows "Print" instead of "Print button" as accessible name property.

<!--
     Microsoft prioritizes making our products accessible. 
     WinForms has a key role in allowing developers to create accessible apps. 
     
     When submitting a change which impacts UI in any way, including adding new UI or
     modifying existing controls the developer needs to run the Accessibility Insights
     tool (https://accessibilityinsights.io/) and verify that there are no changes or
     regressions. 
     
     The developer should run the Fast Pass over the impacted control(s) and provide
     a snapshot of the passing results along with before/after snapshots of the UI.
     More info: (https://accessibilityinsights.io/docs/en/web/getstarted/fastpass)
  -->

## Test environment(s)

.NET Core SDK (reflecting any global.json):
 Version:   3.0.100-preview8-012929
 Commit:    795f8aeaa8

Runtime Environment:
 OS Name:     Windows
 OS Version:  10.0.18362
 OS Platform: Windows
 RID:         win10-x64
 Base Path:   C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\3.0.100-preview8-012929\


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix 1353 Accessibility: Removing 'button' text from PrintButton accessible name of PrintPreviewDialog" (#1354)

Issues.Title: Accessibility: Name property of "Print button" in Print Preview dialog must not include the same text as its LocalizedControlType/ControlType properties
Issues.Body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create .NET Core WinForms application and add PrintPreviewDialog control to it.
2. Build and run it, open Print preview dialog.
3. Inspect the accessibility names of the dialog.

**Actual:**
The Name property of "Print button" in Print Preview dialog include the same text/element as its LocalizedControlType/ControlType properties and announced by Narrator as "Print button button"

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23213980/61125733-45e13880-a4b3-11e9-96bb-0bf0720998b5.png)

Violation: Section 508 502.3.1

**Expected:** 
The Name property of "Print button" in Print Preview dialog must not include the same text as its LocalizedControlType/ControlType properties.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Accessibility: Name property of "Print button" in Print Preview dialog must not include the same text as its LocalizedControlType/ControlType properties" (#1353)

Issues.Title: Move ResXResourceWriter out of System.Windows.Forms
Issues.Body:
In Entity Framework 6, we need to [generate resx files](https://github.com/aspnet/EntityFramework6/blob/6.2.0/src/EntityFramework.PowerShell/Migrations/Utilities/MigrationWriter.cs#L69-L72) at design time.

Now that we're porting to .NET Core, it's infeasible for us to depend on System.Windows.Forms.

Would it be possible to move this type to the existing System.Resources.Writer assembly in corefx or even just its own new package independent of Microsoft.WindowsDesktop.App? (e.g. System.Resources.ResX)

cc @divega @ajcvickers @Pilchie
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Move ResXResourceWriter out of System.Windows.Forms" (#1342)

Issues.Title: Executes the given Action on the thread that owns this Control's underlying window handle.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Executes the given Action on the thread that owns this Control's underlying window handle. " (#1347)

Issues.Title: Add MyType to VB WinForms template
Issues.Body:
This is needed in support of getting VB code that uses My.* working out of the box.

Sync with @KathleenDollard on the correct content, but I think we want the following:
``` xml
<PropertyGroup>
  <MyType>Console</MyType>
</PropertyGroup>
```
Eventually we will want MyType=WindowsForms that you get in the classic VB WPF project, but Console is what works now.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Add MyType to VB WinForms template" (#1346)

Issues.Title: Replace DpiAwarenessContext enum with Windows DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT everywhere in the code
Issues.Body:
All the P/Invokes for DPI related APIs work with DPI_AWARENESS or DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT.
It is incorrect to use our own DpiAwarenessContext enum. 

We need to update P/Invoke headers of all such APIs and update all code invocations appropriately.

For more discussion check: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/1331
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Replace DpiAwarenessContext enum with Windows DPI_AWARENESS_CONTEXT everywhere in the code" (#1344)

Issues.Title: Form.FormBorderStyle == SizeableToolWindow not working.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: Preview 6
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:** Setting FormBorderStyle to SizeableToolWindow is not working.

**Actual behavior:** Same caption bar height as a Sizeable form.

**Expected behavior:** The caption bar should be narrower, as in .NET Framework.

**Minimal repro:**: change the property in the main form of a minimal project, change its FormBorderStyle, run and compare.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Form.FormBorderStyle == SizeableToolWindow not working." (#1338)
